subanswer.text: To understand this better, consider smaller cases ($|\underline{m}| = 2$) before generalizing further. A possible construction method involves iteratively selecting edges while avoiding previously connected pairs until no new vertices remain unconnected.[Here’s visualization ]Let's elaborate stepwise:- Select edge AB; now remove BA vertex since already visited.- Next select AC excluding BC because they share common node C ; continue similarly till end.[Intuitively,] If at every stage we ensure not revisiting a path traversed earlier via 'selection guiding', eventually connectivity across entire graph remains intact without repetitive links.__Note__It does seem complex initially, however simplistic patterns emerge once understood properly – donotgetlostinthecomplexity!![Image credit:]Another perspective lies within recursive strategy–connect upto nth level sequentially ,removing redundant connections subsequently..
